page.title: 08 LANDSCAPE NABURN LOCKS
page.content: Naburn locks are on the River Ouse.The busiest time for boats going through the locks is at the weekends mostly Saturdays.The locks are open 7 days a week.It costs Â£7.50 to go through the locks.The locks flood regularly in winter.Boats sometimes get stuck,once a boat got stuck,it took 5 hours to get it out.There are lots of people who have fallen in.The lockeepers houses are opposite the locks.It takes 15 minutes to go through the locks.The locks have to be cleaned out to get all the mud out,this is done by a dredger.Most of the boats that go through are barges,but also large and small cruisers and canoes go through.
